channel.title: Articles on Economic Indicators (Beta)
channel.description: Recent content in Articles on Economic Indicators (Beta)

item.title: Components of GDP
item.description: The components of Gross Domestic Product (GDP) GDP is divided into four parts: Consumption, Investment, Government Purchase, and Net Export. Net export is export minus import. These four parts are various forms of spending on domestically produced goods and services. US: GDP measured by components of demand US Demand from Consumption, Investment and Government Purchase Nepal: GDP measured by components of demand This shows the different component of GDP by percentage.

item.title: Historical Growth and Recession
item.description: Historical Growth and Recession The graph shows the US quarterly data on real GDP from 1947 to 2020. Shaded vertical bars represent recession or contraction.

item.title: International Trade
item.description: Nepal International Trade International Trade time series plot. This graph shows US export and import. Nepal International Trade International Trade time series plot. This graph shows export import.
